Spire Orthopedic Partners is a growing national partnership of orthopedic practices that provides the support, capital and operational resources physicians need to grow thriving practices for the future. As a Management Services Organization (MSO), Spire provides the infrastructure for administrative operations that allows practices to operate at their highest level, so doctors can focus their efforts on what matters most patient care. Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, Spire Orthopedic Partners is a growing partnership of orthopedic practices that provides the support, capital and operational resources physicians need to grow thriving practices in todays evolving healthcare landscape. The Spire network spans the Northeast with more than 165 physicians, 1,800 employees, 285 other clinical providers and 40 locations in New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island and Massachusetts.
What youll do:
Responsibilities/Duties:
* Meets patients and prepares them for procedures.
* Assists patients as needed with walking transfers, dressing, collecting specimens & preparing for exam, etc.
* Gets DMEs for doctors or nurses.
* Fulfills environmental responsibilities as assigned that may include setting up instruments and equipment according to department protocols.
* Cleaning exam/procedure rooms, instruments, equipment between patient visits to maintain infection control
column2: cleaning sterilizer according to scheduled maintenance program.

column1: * Keeping appropriate records
column2: ordering, sorting, storing supplies
column3: and restocking exam/procedure rooms.

column1: * Position requires coverage for other locations when needed.
* Takes and records patients vital signs before and after procedures.
* Assists doctors with various procedures and provides materials and guidance as needed.
* Unpacks supply deliveries and stores away items as directed.

* Assists members of clinical support staff and physicians with all duties as necessary and appropriate (includes patient care, post-op phone follow-up calls and other patient phone calls, medication updates).
* Documents all phone calls and actions appropriately in EMR.
* Identifies OSHA issues and communicates for correction.
* Follows all HIPAA regulations as instructed.
* Follows ONS policies and procedures.
* Performs other duties/projects as assigned.
* General knowledge of office procedures and computer systems.
* Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
* Ability to handle high stress, busy work environment.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
Who you are:
Qualifications:
* High school diploma or GED.
* Knowledge of Word & Outlook required.
* Orthopedic and/or casting experience preferred.
* Knowledge of GE Centricity is a plus.
* Pleasant, professional, and articulate phone skills.
* Knowledge of medical terminology.
* Strong organizational skills
* Medical Assistant Certification preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
What we offer:
* Excellent growth and advancement opportunities
* Dynamic environment
* Access to a diverse network of practitioners
* Broad infrastructure of tools and programs to enhance the employee experience
* Competitive Compensation
* Generous PTO
* Benefits package: health, dental, vision, 401(k), etc.

e55da93c0a82e837,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=e55da93c0a82e837","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68818504960","Fixed Income Sales Trader – Municipal Bonds","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",150000.0,250000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","Citi Global Wealth Investments Brokerage Fixed Income Specialist for the Americas. This role is based within Investments Solutions Capital Markets and will be part of Fixed Income Brokerage and Advisory Team for the Americas. The Fixed Income Specialist will be responsible for delivering best in class fixed income advice, guidance and execution services to Advisors and Clients of Citi Global Wealth Americas, with a specific focus on municipal markets. This position will offer the opportunity to grow the Fixed Income Brokerage (Taxable and Non-Taxable) business within Citi Global Wealth by preparing and delivering trade ideas, performing portfolio reviews, and educating Clients on the benefits of transactional brokerage Fixed Income. The Fixed Income Specialist will work directly with internal Financial Advisors, Bankers, Investment Counselors, and their Clients to help them transact and build brokerage portfolios of Fixed Income securities.
**Responsibilities**
* Deliver trade ideas and investment opportunities, while providing the highest level of execution service and advice, specifically focusing on municipal bond markets.
* Remain abreast of fixed income market intelligence, investment strategy and research to deliver actionable trade ideas to Financial Advisors, Bankers, Investment Counselors and Clients.
* Act as a fixed income product expert while working in accordance with the business product programs, processes and procedures.
* Ensure seamless execution, booking and reporting of fixed income brokerage transactions.
* Increase client participation across the entirety of fixed income brokerage business.
* Actively participate in regional sales and marketing forums to promote fixed income brokerage product capabilities.
* Actively design and implement product and platform improvements to enhance the Advisor and Client experience.
**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 10 years in a fixed income product, sales, or trading role preferably within a wealth management organization such as a Private Bank or Broker-Dealer.
* Specific experience in municipal bonds, both primary and secondary markets.
* Experience with brokerage fixed income, as well as portfolio analytic tools and interest rate pricing models.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work on a team.
* Self-motivated to provide proactive trade ideas within taxable and municipal markets.
* Previous exposure to high net worth Private Clients and Family Offices would be beneficial.

* Ability to handle multiple tasks at the same time, explain complex concepts in a clear and simple language, and educate clients on the risks and potential benefits of transacting in fixed income products.
* Strong IT and analytical skills essential.
* Strong knowledge of the regulatory environment surrounding retail fixed income brokerage.
* Series 7 and 63 required.
**Education**
* Bachelor's degree or higher
**Job Family Group:**
Private Client Product Services
**Job Family:**
Investment Capital Markets
**Time Type:**
Full time
**Primary Location:**
New York New York United States
**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:**

a195a776f7c6a934,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a195a776f7c6a934","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68810680656","TTS FI Client Executive, SVP","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",149600.0,224400.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","The Client Executive will be dedicated to a portfolio of Financial Institution (FI) & Non-Bank Financial Institution (NBFI) clients with the overall objective to support their global growth and provide seamless delivery of the full suite of TTS services.

Through disciplined calling, the Client Executive will be responsible for all aspects of the relationship with the customer, including service provision, organic revenue growth and compliance and risk management.

The Client Executive is a key member of a unique global relationship network that is widely regarded as being best in class for client coverage and delivery of banking solutions in over 100 countries.
**Key Responsibilities:**
**Revenue Realization & Retention**
* Responsible for cross selling and commercialization of new or enhanced TTS products and services to increase wallet penetration.
* Complete regular relationship reviews that incorporate all parts of the client's TTS business, including analysis on profitability, new opportunities, and pricing.
* Drive growth of portfolio by matching client needs and strategic business objectives to Citi’s cash management and trade solutions.
* Input all pipeline opportunities and won deals into CRM.
* Manage won opportunities through implementation.
* Work with partners to remove roadblocks and where possible accelerate revenue realization.
* Monitor deals post implementation to ensure utilization of the product and revenue realization based on deal estimates.
**Client Experience**

* Be the client advocate to ensure issues are addressed promptly by working with partners across TTS and utilizing client forums, such as the Client at Risk process, to facilitate and drive resolution.
* Be responsible for driving best in class client experience (monitoring Pulse surveys and leverage internal tools to monitor satisfaction levels across the organization).
* Take ownership, lead, and track specific issues/problems while holding partners accountable to deliver on client’s requirements.
* Develop a relationship with client decision makers and influencers, to build and maintain “Trusted Adviser” status.

* Enhance collaboration across product and client groups. Partner with product specialists to drive overall client satisfaction through Voice of the Client, build client loyalty, and respond to client escalation issues.
* Understand the dynamics of the local financial markets, banking and payment industries, and regulatory environments.
* Have a deep understanding of our competition by client and be able to provide valuable input to support the TTS Sales organization.
* Manage client’s expectations and effectively engage in difficult discussions with clients.
* Strengthen the client relationship by working closely with product partners across TTS.

* Serve as a key client contact point and be ultimately responsible for all aspects of the relationship with the customer, including organic revenue growth, service provision, compliance and risk management.
**Development Value:**
* Ownership of target market portfolio and being successful in a highly competitive market.
* Experience working within a cross-regional team that allows for building network relationships outside of country base.
* Opportunity to be part of, highly visible strategic initiative for FI TTS.
**Competencies:**
* Ability to translate client needs into opportunities through active listening
* Excellent negotiation skills
* Disciplined, highly organized and self-motivated.
* Highly accurate worker with high level of attention to details.
* Able to perform under pressure and work to deadlines.
* Results and service oriented.
* Very strong interpersonal skills required to work in a highly demanding teamwork environment.
* Be a complete “team-player”.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to manage and solve problems and conflicts.
* Strong leadership and influence skills.
* Respect for Compliance and Controls
**Qualifications:**
* 10+ years of relationship management or equivalent experience
* Educated to degree level or equivalent
* Fluent written and verbal English
column2: bilingual desired

column1: * Leadership, team management experience desired
* 25% travel required

**Job Family:**

5ebcd8fe52dc0995,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=5ebcd8fe52dc0995","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68810516208","Corporate Salesperson","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",150000.0,160000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","Citigroup Global Markets Inc. seeks a Corporate Salesperson for its New York, NY location.

Duties: Advise Citi’s corporate clients on interest rate and foreign exchange risk management strategies. Apply in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contribute to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and workflow for the area or function. Integrate latest market trends and industry expertise to provide holistic risk management hedging solutions. Collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluate moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Filter, prioritize, and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources using analytical skills. Regularly assume informal/formal leadership role within teams with communication and diplomacy skills. Handle outside of the day-to-day client responsibilities. A telecommuting/hybrid work schedule may be permitted within a commutable distance from the worksite, in accordance with Citi policies and protocols.

Requirements: Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Finance, Computing & Data Science, or a related field, and two (2) years of experience in the job offered, or in a related occupation in the financial services industry. Two (2) years of experience must include: Providing advice and guidance to clients on strategic derivatives transactions, including the buying and selling of securities and FX, tailored to align with clients’ hedging objectives
column2: Driving team's developed strategy across specified product lines by analyzing clients’ businesses and exposures to provide best suited sales solutions in full coordination with all relevant business partners
column3: Executing bespoke structured derivatives for clients and utilizing market insights to assist clients in optimizing their derivative position to capture market opportunities and maximize interest savings
column4: Interfacing with appropriate internal partners to enhance share of mind with clients, increase dialogue, and deliver on expertise
column5: Working in close partnership with control functions including Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, and Finance to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure
column6: and calculating credit usage using CVA and RWA/ Basel concepts to meet adequate returns on transactions. 40 hrs./wk. 20% domestic travel required. Applicants submit resumes at https://jobs.citi.com/. Please reference Job ID # 24754013. EO Employer.

78c92eca1124f86d,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=78c92eca1124f86d","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68826108320","Global Head of Product Marketing (C15 / Director)","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",170000.0,300000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","Product Marketing supports the growth of our market-leading Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) business by building and enabling a more connected TTS global proposition and client-centric content, allowing client-facing teams to further enhance their trusted advisor position. The primary focus for Product Marketing is to deliver a) integrated content quality and management and b) cross-product solutions development & commercialization.
**Citi Overview**:

As the leading treasury and trade services bank offering the world’s largest network, we manage the banking needs of global clients across ~95 countries in 144 currencies. We enable payments of our clients worth $4 trillion daily and we provide trade services to 97% of top 500 companies in Forbes Global 2000.

We are the #1 in transaction banking for institutional clients and have some of the most innovative solutions in the industry. If you are interested in working for an industry leader who is shaping the future, we are interested in hearing from you.
**The Role**:

* We are looking for a dynamic and seasoned domain expert in the Treasury and Trade Services (TTS)/Transaction Banking space to lead our Global Product Marketing function. This role will report to the Global Head of Product and Segment Marketing.

* The Product Marketing Director will be a senior-level executive who oversees the marketing of TTS products. They will play a crucial role in understanding the market, defining the product’s position within that market, and communicating its value to both internal teams and potential customers.
* This role involves strategic planning, team leadership, and close collaboration with sales, marketing, and product development teams to ensure the product’s success in the market.

* The Product Marketing Director leads the strategy behind how our products are brought to market, positioned, and sold. They are responsible for crafting compelling messaging, identifying target customer segments, and developing marketing plans that drive demand and adoption of the product.
* The ultimate goals of the Product Marketing Director will be to establish TTS products as market leaders, drive revenue growth, and enhance customer satisfaction.

* Given Product Marketing’s role and close partnership with functions (Sales, Products, Regions, and other Marketing organizations), the team will drive horizontal client facing content and cross-product solutions across all TTS business areas. The key to success of this role will be ability to build trusted partnerships with wide range of stakeholders across TTS. As the Product Marketing Director, this role will collaborate closely with both global and regional teams to assist driving the client agenda.
The individual will drive the global strategy and execution of two key pillars:
**Cross Product Solutions Development and Commercialization**
* Develop and commercialize integrated solutions comprising thematic content and relevant analytics, ultimately delivering incremental value to our clients.
* Enhance client targeting and segmentation through analytics for integrated solutions working in coordination with Sales (Inc Inside Sales) and Data & Analytics teams.
* Coordination with Sales and Data & Analytics teams to ensure the prioritization and development of high impact data tools.

* Lead global go-to-market strategy and messaging for new and existing products, develop positioning that differentiates the product in the market, manage product launches and releases and promote the product both internally and externally.

* Produce content and enablement materials for internal teams and empower our Sales teams with playbooks, customer stories, competitive positioning and a strong feedback loop between sales, product, and product commercialization teams.

* Sit on the leadership of the Product GTM Experiences team and advocate for an understanding of our customer through research and discovery work, translating their needs to influence our product roadmaps and to implement marketing strategies.
**Integrated Content Quality and Management**
* Assist the Product teams in developing enhanced and integrated content for our client ecosystems and growth missions capturing TTS’ value to solve relevant client needs.
* Coordinate content creation from a client perspective across liquidity, payments (including commercial cards), trade, platform & data services and partnerships & innovation.
* Coordination of content approvals with relevant second line functions including compliance and legal.
* Work closely with other Marketing teams to align the product positioning to TTS umbrella messaging framework and manage the distribution of relevant client content materials.
* Content ownership across the TTS content repository.
* Develop the company and product positioning, messaging, and storytelling to establish Citi TTS as the leader across our markets.
Key responsibilities will include:

* **Developing Marketing Strategies**: Crafting and executing comprehensive marketing plans to promote products and achieve business goals. **Market Research:** Conducting market research to understand customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape. **Product Positioning:** Defining product positioning, messaging, and value propositions to differentiate the product in the market. **Go-to-Market Planning:** Developing go-to-market strategies, including launch plans, promotional activities, and sales enablement. **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Working closely with product management, sales, and other departments to ensure that marketing strategies are aligned with product capabilities and sales objectives, enabling successful product launches. **Content Creation:** Overseeing the creation of marketing content, such as product collateral, white papers, case studies, and sales tools. **Performance Tracking:** Analyzing and reporting on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and initiatives, and making data-driven adjustments. **Customer Engagement:** Building relationships with customers and understanding their feedback to improve product offerings and marketing strategies. **Budget Management:** Managing the marketing budget and ensuring efficient allocation of resources. **Leadership:** Leading and mentoring a team of marketing professionals.
**Specific Skills Required:**

This is a role requiring ability to work effectively and in partnership all across TTS, champion progress, problem solve and lead change. Strategic thinking, excellent communication, and a commercial mindset are pivotal to success. Someone who is an independent thinker with an entrepreneurial attitude, natural collaborator with the ability to lead complex cross functional projects would be an ideal fit with 10-15 years broad experience in transaction banking, including client facing and/or product experience.
* Strong leadership with the ability to work across products, functions, regions globally – partnership, trust and credibility
* Forward thinker with a strategic mindset and focus on solving client needs
* Commercially focused who looks at new ways to deliver exceptional results for our clients
* Broad understanding of global treasury and trade business is a must
* Understanding of client needs, product discipline and industry dynamics and disruptions in the TTS space is required
* Creativity in both logic and visual design when crafting solutions and messages for clients
* Excellent communication and presentation skills – verbal, visual and written – for internal and external purposes
* Collaborative nature, able to engage with a diverse range of individuals of all levels and gain support from colleagues, even when they do not report directly to you
* Analytical mindset to take various initiatives and sources and translate into thematic content and messaging
* Strong discipline to manage Product Marketing budget spend
**Competency Skills:**
* Strong managerial skills to lead a global team
* Ability to influence people across a wide range of functions and disciplines
* Ability to manage multiple, simultaneous, long-term initiatives and priorities activities
* Desire to work in a collaborative environment supporting multiple individuals
* Ability to think critically and solve non-traditional problems / bridge key gaps
**Education:**
* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing , Business Administration, Communications or related field., required. Master's Degree preferred.
**Job Family Group:**
Product Management and Development
**Job Family:**
Product Performance Management
**Time Type:**
Full time
**Primary Location:**
New York New York United States
**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:**

d592eb18ca5d8ffb,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=d592eb18ca5d8ffb","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68826206400","Program Management SVP (Hybrid)","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",163600.0,245400.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**Job Description:** Program Management SVP
**Location:** New York, NY

The Business Risk and Control Sr Officer I is a strategic professional who closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business. Typically, a small number of people within the business that provide the same level of expertise. Excellent communication skills required to negotiate internally, often at a senior level. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Accountable for significant direct business results or authoritative advice regarding the operations of the business. Necessitates a degree of responsibility over technical strategy. Primarily affects a sub-function. Responsible may include handling staff management issues, including resource management and allocation of work within the team/project
**Responsibilities:**

* Work with Management on governance and the facilitation of the execution of the Manager Control Assessment (MCA, i.e..Risk & Control Self-Assessment) as required by the MCA Standard including the assessment and appropriate approval of risk associated with business changes.

* Accountable for the quality, completeness, and accuracy of the implementation of the Control Framework, including Risk Control Policy, Control Standard, Issue Management Policy, Lesson Learned Policy and Control Inventory.

* Ensure the identification of issue root cause, partnering with control and process owners to recommend holistic corrective actions and improvements, provide check and challenge to ensure appropriate escalation in according with Issue Management and Escalation Policies.

* Support the implementation of the Lessons Learned Policy, including monitoring of control breaches and dissemination and learnings across other business units for process improvement to limit the occurrence of similar future events and where similar risk exposure might exist.

* Support management in the review and challenge process, within the FLUs, on the effective design and management of controls to mitigate risks as required by the Control Standards, including implementation and operation, conducting the control monitoring, handling deficiencies, and escalating issues for resolution.
* With management, direct teams on the timeliness, accuracy and completeness of the MCA through controls prior to the execution of a process (QC).
* Assess, with management, the adherence to the MCA Standard through controls after the execution of a process (QA).
* Assist management in exercising control over Operational and Compliance Risk in accordance with established Policy requirements.

* Help management allocate resource to identify, assess, escalate, and manage risk exposures across Risk Categories (Operational Compliance, Strategic, Reputational, etc), including material, emerging and concentration risks in accordance with enterprise Policies and the establishment of Key Indicators to monitor risk exposures.
* Assess, with management, Risk Appetite and monitor / assess exposures against this in accordance with enterprise requirements (if applicable).
* Take ownership to identify, assess, record and response to Operational and Compliance Risk events, ensuring these are captured accurately, timely and in accordance with requirements.
* Responsible that adequate governance and training are in place to support management of Risk profiles.
* Assess, with management, the risks associated with New Activities and changes to the Business, ensuring these are well understood and adequately controlled (if applicable).
* Support management on operational risk scenario analysis and stress testing for Operational Risk Capital requirements.

* Be responsible of risk and control assessments or coordination for programs within various risk stripes and ensure sufficient subject matter expertise exists to enable management of these risks within the Business (e.g. third party, fraud, sanctions etc) (if applicable).
* Take ownership to ensure that risk and control responsibilities and accountabilities are embedded within FLUs, including providing training and leading by example.
* Assist management in guiding and influencing standards and procedures that conform to enterprise requirements and support sound operational and compliance risk management.
* Apply knowledge of the business, products or services to identify and implement control points and processes throughout the business.

* Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
**Qualifications:**
* 10+ years of experience as a Risk and Control Management professional
* Familiarity with Control Frameworks, Transformation, 3rd party risk models.
* Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
* Audit, 2LoD, Consulting experience a plus
**Education:**
Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred.
**Job Family Group:**
Risk Management
**Job Family:**
Business Risk & Control
**Time Type:**
Full time
**Primary Location:**
New York New York United States
**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:**

23d3059461c9a59f,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=23d3059461c9a59f","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68826241936","Services – Treasury and Trade Solutions, Full Time Analyst, New York - US, 2025","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",95000.0,130000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","Job Description**You’re the brains behind our work.**

You’re ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom, and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it’s honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can’t come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team and establish a long-term career here. At Citi, we value internal mobility, and career growth is not a question of if, but when.

Citi’s Service’s business is looking for full-time Analysts to join the Treasury and Trade Solutions team in North America. TTS works with international clients to streamline financial processes and make transactions seamless. TTS provides innovative solutions to public sector clients, corporations and financial institutions in more than 120 countries, including 99 of the Fortune Global 100 companies.
**We provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed.**

Here at Citi, rotational programs are intended to help you build a broad skillset and accelerate your career growth by gaining exposure to numerous roles. The 2.5-year Analyst program starts in mid-July and begins with an intensive training program. You will then rotate across 2 areas within Treasury & Trade Solutions, where you will have hands-on experience working across TTS business lines and business functions.
**Your typical day will look something like this:**
* Client Sales Management
* Cash Management Services including Liquidity & Investments, Receivables, Payments, Wholesale Cards, and Channel & Enterprise Services
* Trade projects including Commodities Financing, Trade Finance, Trade Services and Export & Agency Finance
* Risk, Marketing, Technology
**We want to hear from you if…**
* You are in your final year of college with a preferred GPA of 3.5 or above (graduating in Fall 2024 or Spring 2025)
* You will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future
* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* MS Word, Access, Excel, and PowerPoint are second nature
* You have an interest in business
**Who we think will be a great fit…**

We’re looking for motivated individuals, who are eager to start their careers at a global organization, tend to think globally, and have an innovative outlook on business. We know that anyone—not just those with business degrees—can have a knack for business, so we’re open to all disciplines. We value diversity and so do you.
We’ll also be looking for the following:
* Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills
* High level of personal integrity, commitment to excellence, and a strong desire to learn
* Resiliency to work in a challenging and changing high-volume, fast-paced environment
* Sense of urgency and ability to execute quickly and efficiently
**Job Family Group:**
Product Management and Development
**Job Family:**
Market Segments and Services
**Time Type:**
Full time
**Primary Location:**
New York New York United States
**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:**

8f455016e3a71ef9,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=8f455016e3a71ef9","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68819014848","Services Head of Strategic Program Management - Director","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",200000.0,300000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","Citi Services - Commerce is changing, business models are shifting, trade corridors are unsettled, and 24/7 moves at hyper speed. From treasury services designed to un-limit your business growth to scalable, securities management solutions that support your boldest ambitions, Citi Services is charting a clear path from complexity to performance.

The Services Program Management & Execution team is responsible for managing the delivery of the Organizations Strategic Book of Work. The interconnected and multi-layered nature of this Portfolio requires a robust program management discipline that focuses on improving levels of accountability, managing risks & issues, streamlining communication & status reporting and formalizing the decision-making process
**Position**

The Head of Strategic Program Management will directly manage and coach a team comprised of 6 -10 senior Program Managers responsible for overseeing the successful execution of multiple programs across Services.

This role requires a comprehensive understanding of multiple areas within a function and how they interact in order to achieve the objectives of the function. Applies in-depth understanding of the business impact of technical contributions. Strong commercial awareness is a necessity. Excellent communication skills required to negotiate across all levels of the organization. It will support a wide range of sponsors and stakeholders for the purposes of providing status updates and ensuring that all programs are meeting key milestones and success criteria. The individual will be working within a large matrixed team across Product Management, Operations and Technology and will work hand-in-hand with partners to ensure continuous alignment to our overall Services Strategy. The Head of Strategic program management will also be asked to Strategic Program Manager will also be asked to drive execution of complex initiatives that require senior management interaction and alignment across the Services organization. This role will be part of the Services COO team, reporting to the Services Global Head of Program Management & Execution and be accountable on a day-to-day basis to the Services Senior Executive Leadership team.
**Responsibilities**
* Directly manages team that is comprised of 6-10 senior PMs.
* Leads by example, demonstrating ethics, judgment and integrity in decisions and actions. PM Success Coaching
* Actively manages the demand of work and assigns to the team. Manages stakeholder relationships and portfolio pipeline.
* Manage capacity and program allocation cooperatively across the portfolio.
* Prioritize and allocate resources based on business priorities and in conjunction with senior management.

* Ensures programs adhere to Citi PM Policy and Standards for process, tools and quality assurance, while driving consistency of deliverables and artifacts across all programs in the portfolio. Enforces standards.
* Recruits and retains talent.
* Manage consolidated senior level reporting on all program activities and risk

* Handles all aspects of performance management and provides PM team with timely performance feedback. Performs ongoing coaching and professional development of staff. Collects performance feedback from key stakeholders.
* Oversees the creation and signoff of Portfolio programs plans and charters, benefits management plans, stakeholder management plans, acceptance plans, and central Program issue logs
* Fosters a comprehensive understanding of how own area and others collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business objectives.
* Understands interdependencies and strategic impact, balances priorities and mitigates issues.
* Ensures all stakeholders are identified and included in scope definition activities and understand the project schedule and key milestones
* Persuades and influences others through developed communication and diplomacy skills with colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers
* Collaborates with knowledgeable and demanding stakeholders to establish project plans for major initiatives and drive efforts to a successful conclusion.
* Meets regularly with key clients and stakeholders to ensure expectations are met, obstacles are addressed, and relationships are proactively managed.
* Coordinates with Technology, Operations and other functional teams to deliver consistent and efficient process/platform enhancements, providing hands-on support.
* Ensures coherent and concise communications detailing the scope, progress and results of initiatives underway. Escalates as necessary and keeps senior management informed of key issues.
* Establish complex operating structure and program governance across Citi enterprise to support key strategic, risk and regulatory initiatives.

* Provide day-to-day management and “hands-on” end-to-end responsibility for coordinating the outcomes across all programs in the Initiative. Orchestrate and drive the successful & timely completion of initiatives to achieve the initiative goals.
**Qualifications**
* 10+ years in Project Management positions, whether in IT or technical business areas.
* Financial Services, Markets or Banking background.
* Solid proven experience in Portfolio or Program Management.
* PMI PMP qualified and/or equivalent with proven experience across Agile and Waterfall environments preferred.
* Ability to operate at different levels: to analyze issues, synthesize them. Develop themes. Understand risks, translate lessons learned into actions.

Providing full leadership and direction to a team of employees in order to drive business growth, acquire new relationships, grow the book of business, ensure a culture of world-class customer experience and foster community engagement in a newly opened Branch (De Novo). The overall objective of this role is to lead a world class team, grow balances, build customer loyalty, collaborate with key partners across Wealth, Lending, Business Banking and Community Engagement and recommend the development of business strategies or initiatives.
**Responsibilities:**
* Develop sales plans and drive production goals, including building referral network and relationships with internal partners and external contacts
* Create an environment through activity-based coaching and performance development and implement/execute coaching plan to develop employee’s skill set to achieve individual/branch goals

* Develop and execute integrated sales, relationship, and credit strategies that are aligned with the Retail Bank's priorities, execute business plan to achieve expected goals in all business categories
* Support portfolio growth by identifying opportunities to deepen relationships and increase client acquisition and ensure clients receive optimal service and monitor/adhere to operational controls
* Collaborate with branch partners to successfully achieve goals, build customer relationship and deliver customer service

* Develop a Center of Influence (COI) network by engaging in business networking and community activities. Actively represent Citibank in the community, create local community awareness that the bank is critically focused on partnering in the community and providing multi-product banking solutions to our clients. Maintain frequent interaction with COIs, community leaders and senior business contacts, with the goal of developing consistent business referral that will contribute to market share growth.
* Leverage workforce planning tool to optimize staffing in branches and set expectations for branch staff, fostering an environment in which team members work together to achieve all business goals
* Integrate segment partners, to drive sales and drive outbound sales activities including: representing Citi and building partnerships in the community
* Conduct daily proof processes to ensure adherence to operational requirements

The overall objective of this role is to ensure the seamless delivery of securities and derivatives transactions.

The Global Rates Middle Office and Corporate Treasury Operations Manager will oversee global teams managing these two functions focused on driving consistency, efficiency and ensuring the teams have effective risk management and regulatory processes in place. This role requires a strategic leader with extensive experience in financial markets, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to manage a diverse team across different time zones.
**Responsibilities:**
* Develop a partnership with the business, ensuring that the team are well positioned to support business growth.
* Develop partnerships with Technology, Compliance Risk, Finance, HR and key internal stakeholders
* Act as a strategic partner with all potential stakeholders in onboarding new and complex transactions, ensuring procedures are properly embedded, supported and risk managed on an ongoing basis.
* Assist with the planning of actions and resources to support new business.

* Manage complex and variable operations related issues (e.g. across trade booking / settlement / confirmations / etc.), define and communicate problems, develop innovative solutions, streamline processes and lead change-the-bank initiatives.
* Ensuring proactive the team are proactively engaged with industry initiatives.
* Closely follow trends in the industry, identify cost saving opportunities and build effective relationships with clients and key stakeholders.
* Increase scale and efficiencies by analyzing and presenting data to develop new solutions and oversee the integrity of process.
* Assist with overseeing the risk control environment, compliance efforts to follow policies and procedures and keep abreast of Citi's operational processes and best practices in business strategy.
* Serve as an analytical and procedural expert in the full trade life cycle while supporting a wide range of internal and external clients.
* Serve as an advisor and coach to staff on procedures and work processes across multiple departments.

* Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
**Qualifications:**
* 15+ years of relevant experience
* Advanced level experience in a related role with extensive experience in business, functional and people management preferred
* Experience in managing a Rates Middle Office team within Banking and Financial Services Institutions preferred
* Demonstrated analytical skills
* Proven ability to manage various concurrent activities/projects in a high-risk environment
* Effective project management and negotiation skills
* Consistently demonstrated clear and concise written and verbal communication
* Demonstrated success dealing with senior and executive management
* Consistently demonstrated clear and concise written and verbal communication
**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent industry experience

3cb2482207b19daa,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3cb2482207b19daa","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68810667328","Technology Product Manager - SVP","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",163600.0,245400.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**About Citi:**

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do from keeping the bank safe, managing global resources, and providing the technical tools our workers need to be successful to designing our digital architecture and ensuring our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. We reimagine client and partner experiences to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and efficient services

Citi’s Functions Technology is responsible for delivering Technology solutions to Citi's Functions organizations. Functions Technology mission is to optimize Citi's Technology environment by delivering world class applications, driving standardization of the production environment, reducing complexity, optimizing management of systems supporting global functions such as Compliance, Controls, Internal Audit and Risk, and introducing innovative technologies that provide new business capabilities, reduce the technology total cost of ownership, and create a competitive advantage for Citi.

TheTechnology Product Managerin Operational Risk Technology is a strategic professional who closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business. Recognized as subject matter expert within Operational Risk 1st and 2nd line oversight functions. Excellent communication skills required in order to negotiate internally, often at a senior level. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Accountable for significant direct business results or authoritative advice regarding the operations of the business. Necessitates a degree of responsibility over technical strategy. Primarily affects a sub-function. Responsible for handling staff management issues, including resource management and allocation of work within the team/project.
**Responsibilities**

* As a senior technology product manager, you will be responsible for entire product lifecycle of technology solutions (from ideation to launch), supporting Operational Risk 1st line, 2nd line oversight and regulatory reporting functions.
* Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders for defining product vision and technology roadmap.
* Work closely with engineering teams, architects and business analysts across multiple regions to ensure the technology solutions meets business goals and complies with firm's technology standards.
* Demonstrating deep technical knowledge and expertise in software development, including programming languages, frameworks, and best practices
* Monitor development to ensure implementation decisions align with company objectives
* Foster a culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.
**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of experience in driving delivery of large-scale enterprise technology solutions
* Ability to collaborate with executives, business leaders, and cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and strategic objectives
* Have a solid understanding of operational risk frameworks particularly in Loss Estimates, Risk categorization, Stress Testing and regulatory reporting
* Be familiar with financial services trends and emerging issues to improve technology solutions in support of operational risk detection.
* Experience in advanced modeling and analytical skills to create meaningful measurement and reporting on key risk exposures.
* Working knowledge of industry practices and standards
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for building strong client relationships.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed
* Eagerness to learn, grow, and progress towards a leadership role within the company.
* Ability to adapt quickly to change and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic setting.
**Education:**
* Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree

Technology
**Job Family:**
Technology Project Management

Full time
**Primary Location:**
New York New York United States
**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:**

060fee60b6643fdb,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=060fee60b6643fdb","https://jobs.citi.com/job/-/-/287/68819034992","VP, Marketing Transformation Lead Analyst - Hybrid","Citi","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-16","direct_data","yearly",129840.0,194760.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","The US Personal Banking (USPB) Marketing Transformation and Delivery (MT&D) organization is responsible for marketing operations, channel delivery and marketing technology in support of the Consumer Bank’s marketing efforts, inclusive of Branded Cards, Retail Bank, Retail Services, Mortgage and Wealth Management.

The VP, Marketing Transformation is critical role within the organization, responsible for supporting a multi-faceted team of professionals charged with defining, driving, and commercializing our Transformation roadmap with a focus on radically improving speed to market, operating efficiency, and quality. The VP will work to support cross-functional teams throughout the enterprise to fundamentally reshape end-to-end capabilities leveraging a diverse consultative toolkit and strong facilitation skills to manifest meaningful change. This role will support various workstream and projects within the roadmap requires an experienced individual, preferably with deep exposure to Consumer Financial Services Marketing capabilities.
He or she should be skilled in driving radical innovation across processes, operating model design, infrastructure, and policy implementation. Core areas of focus include:

* **Define the transformation strategy**: Support in defining strategy, opportunity, and discovery efforts to identify target strategic initiatives while working with leadership to help define the longer-term organizational strategy for change.

* **Mobilize and drive strategic initiatives****:** Scope, mobilize, and drive critical strategic transformation programs with an emphasis on end-to-end change. Leverage a diverse consultative toolkit and advanced facilitation techniques enabling deep collaboration & partnership with extended teams while accelerating the change management lifecycle.

* **Value capture****:** Drive articulation of the value of transformation across the Marketing ecosystem and all change programs impacting priority capabilities. Measure and monitor the impact of change through both operational and financial metrics including improvements in speed to market, campaign agility, and operational risk.

* **Risk & Control:** Support the evolution of our process-based risk framework ensuring future state design simplifies & standardizes the way in which we operate. Work with partners within and outside of Marketing Transformation & Delivery to ensure the organization meets its Risk commitments (e.g. Issue remediation, etc.).
**Qualifications:**
* 5+ Years of experience in Financial Services, Marketing, and/or Digital
* 5+ Years in Marketing including strategy, operations, audience management, channel management, content, and/or MarTech
* Requires attention to detail and good communication skills
* Strong ability to problem solve and sense of ownership
* Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks under aggressive timelines
* Solid communication and presentation skills
* Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated success in building collaborative relationships with the ability to influence the development and execution of key strategies/initiatives
* Ability to work well under tight deadlines in a fast-paced and team-oriented environment
* Execution and results oriented with a desire to drive change and continuous improvement
* Familiarity with strategy development responsibilities with a proven ability to develop multi-year change plans, business cases, and storytelling
* Desired exposure to key applications across the MarTech ecosystem e.g. Aprimo, Adobe, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pega, and/or Naehas
**Education:**
* Bachelor’s/University degree

Marketing
**Job Family:**
Marketing Program Management
**Time Type:**
Full time
**Primary Location:**
New York New York United States
**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:**

Established concierge company is looking for a Per Diem Exercise Physiologist to join our downtown clinic. Our company provides a high-touch concierge experience for our patients, providing a full array of testing and an extensive consultation with a doctor regarding the patient's health status.
This is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated, patient experience oriented Exercise Physiologist to in a team environment and can exemplify the model of patient service we strive for.
The goal: Working for the patient and giving them the knowledge, tools, and motivation to be healthy.

**Responsibilities:** The selected candidate will create exercise plans for patients, administer fitness tests, and grade the overall fitness of the patient. The Exercise Physiologist will create the best plan of action for the patient, assess their needs, and work to improve their overall health. Accurate records for exercises performed, and ability to monitor heart rate during training sessions is required. Must be able to administer Cardiac Stress Tests
**Desired Skills:**
* Ability to create a fitness plan for a patient
* Ability to administer a fitness test
* Great attention to detail
* Ability to use EKG equipment
* Deep knowledge of exercises
* Ability to sympathize with patients
* Great interpersonal skills
**Education and Experience:**
* Master's degree in exercise physiology
* Personal Trainer Certification
**Compensation:** - We offer highly competitive compensation and an excellent lifestyle

Employment Type
Full-Time
*“We deliver innovative treatments to improve the lives of individuals suffering from neuropsychiatric, neurologic and other disorders”*

Intra-Cellular Therapies Inc. is a publicly traded biopharmaceutical company headquartered in New York City. Founded on Nobel-prize winning research, we launched our first commercial product in CNS in 2020 and received approval for an expanded indication in 2021. Currently celebrating our 22nd anniversary, we have a strong pipeline with projects in preclinical development stage through Phase III. We celebrate science, welcome curiosity, expect collaboration and demand integrity and respect in all we do, create and deliver.

The **Manager, Solution Architecture** is responsible for designing and implementing robust business solutions across the enterprise, including the evaluation, definition, technical and data structure, rapid development and deployment of IT-related process and technology initiatives.
This is a hybrid position based in Bedminster, NJ.
Responsibilities:* Partner with ITCI business areas to identify areas where IT can support business needs and goals.

* Contribute to, facilitate, and lead the architectural design of IT solutions, including business rules and functional requirements definition, technical specifications, development, testing and delivery, applying approaches and methodologies such as Agile, Kanban, low-code development, etc.
* Contribute to and facilitate project management activities and issue escalation/resolution within the portfolio of approved IT initiatives.
* Provide day-to-day support to business customers as needed during project planning, delivery, or post-production support.
* Lead and oversee vendors / external business partners participating in the delivery of IT initiatives daily activities.
* Research and understand emerging technologies and trends (low code, generative, AI, etc.) to identify opportunities for innovation in the solutioning approach.
* Create associated technical documentation for solution designs, data flow, and end user training and support.
* Complete all company and job-related training as assigned within the required timelines.
* Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.
Requirements:* Bachelor’s Degree with 4-6+ years of IT experience, with experience in IT business and/or technical support.
* 1+ years of experience with leading and managing development teams.
* Experience with IT development methodologies such as Agile, Kanban, etc.
* Experience in the life sciences industry preferred and consulting experience preferred.
* Must be able to perform all essential functions of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation.

Intra-Cellular Therapies is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Company Overview:
Empowering Health, Enriching Lives: True Care’s Enduring Mission

At True Care¹, we stand as a beacon of compassion and excellence in home healthcare. With a profound commitment to enhancing the quality of life for individuals and families, our mission is to provide holistic, personalized care that empowers health and enriches lives.

Every day, we embark on a journey to bring comfort, vitality, and dignity to those we serve. Our mission is driven by a deep understanding of the unique needs and aspirations of each individual under our care. We believe that home is not just a place but a sanctuary where healing and well-being flourish best. Hence, we endeavor to make this sanctuary a haven of health and happiness.

We pledge to create a nurturing environment where our clients and their families feel heard, valued, and supported. Our highly trained and empathetic professionals are not just caregivers but partners in the pursuit of well-rounded wellness. With a focus on open communication, collaboration, and respect, we forge lasting relationships that transcend the boundaries of traditional healthcare.

Our mission is to be a guiding light, illuminating the path toward optimal health and well-being. As we navigate challenges and triumphs together, we remain resolute in our dedication to uplifting lives, one compassionate interaction at a time.
At True Care, we don't just offer home healthcare – we offer hope, healing, and a brighter tomorrow.
Reporting to: VP of Business Development

Job Summary: As a Community Outreach Associate at True Care, you will play a pivotal role in fostering meaningful connections within the community. This position centers on actively engaging with diverse groups, forming robust partnerships, and amplifying True Care's presence through innovative outreach strategies. Your responsibilities will include generating referrals, orchestrating impactful marketing campaigns, and representing the company at various community events. In this role, you will be instrumental in enhancing True Care's visibility and reputation as a leader in home healthcare, directly contributing to the growth and outreach success of the organization.
Responsibilities:
* Referral Generation: Actively seeking and securing referrals to expand True Care's client base.

* Partnership Development: establish and maintain strong relationships with community organizations and stakeholders, focusing on cultivating referral sources and improving patient census through the start of care for services.
* Strategic Relationship Building: Fostering and nurturing strategically important relationships with an emphasis on long-term community engagement and partnership value.
* Marketing Initiatives: Creating and executing innovative marketing strategies to enhance True Care's visibility.
* Event Participation: Representing True Care at community events, showcasing the company's commitment and services.
* CRM Management: Maintaining accurate records of outreach activities and communications in Salesforce, ensuring data accuracy and timely updates.
* Other Duties: Performing additional tasks as assigned and adapting to evolving organizational needs.
Qualifications:
* A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
* Proven experience in community outreach, marketing, or a similar role, preferably in the healthcare sector.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication abilities.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Demonstrated leadership capabilities.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Salesforce.
Valid driver's license for community engagement purposes
KPI’s:
In this role, success will be measured through a variety of performance indicators aligned with our company's objectives and operational standards. Candidates should be prepared to
engage in goal-oriented work and be evaluated against clear, quantifiable benchmarks to ensure continuous improvement and effectiveness in the position.

True Care provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.
Key Performance Indicators
* Referral Generation Efficiency: Target of 15-20 increase in new referrals per month.
* Community Engagement Impact: Aim to engage with 4 community members or organizations monthly, with a 25% increase in event attendance or participation.
* Partnership Development: Establish and sustain at least 3 new strategic partnerships per quarter.
* CRM Data Management: Maintain 100% accuracy in Salesforce entries, with all data updated within 48 hours of interaction.

* Start-of-Care Processes: Achieve a target of 7 successful start-of-care instances each month.","https://www.indeed.com/cmp/True-Care-3f7aeda7","https://www.truecareny.com/","125 Church Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11218

* A generous benefits package that includes paid time off, health, dental, vision, and 401(k) savings plan with match

* Complete denture soft relines and manufacture temporary crowns
* Perform quality impressions and bite registrations
* Perform digital intraoral scans
* Support patient charting for doctors
* Perform various office tasks as necessary
* Collaborate with practice team to ensure optimum patient satisfaction

* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with patients of all ages and backgrounds
* Commitment to ongoing learning and professional development
* Ability to work collaboratively with other members of the dental team to provide exceptional patient care
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Active license, registration, or permit as required by the state of practice

**Shift Available: Part Time Evenings (MWF 4pm-9pm)/EOW 8am-4pm**

Want to know what makes our employees eager about going to work every day? The people we serve. Being a part of Maplewood requires passion and a desire to help others. Each employee has the ability to touch the hearts of all our seniors and be a part of something bigger than themselves. It’s not just a job. It’s an extraordinary life.

Maplewood Senior Living is a state-of-the-art, forward-thinking senior living provider. We offer a home-like, luxury environment for our residents, allowing them to live “the good life” in a safe environment. As an associate of Maplewood Senior Living, you will have the ability to make a profound difference in the lives of seniors each and every day. As we continue to grow, we are seeking Concierge's to become part of our family. We invite you to take your first step toward a rewarding career with us!
**What we offer**
* **Competitive wages**
* **Flexible shifts**
* **Paid training & uniforms**
* **Growth opportunities**
* **Bonus & incentive programs**

* Competitive Benefits Package: **including medical, dental, vision, 401K, company paid time-off, life insurance policy, insurance deductibles and voluntary Aflac insurance for our full-time employees**
**Primary Responsibilities:**
* Provides a positive first impression to all who enter the community
* Answers and screens all incoming telephone calls in a courteous and professional manner, routes calls and takes messages, as appropriate.
* Receives and processes mail for community staff
* Accept all outgoing mail/packages
* Maintains and updates log of all emergency phone numbers
* Completes new admission sign ins
* Assists in sales process by performing tasks in support of special events and tours
* Performs other general administration duties as necessary
**Education/Experience/Licensure/Certification**
* High School Diploma required
* Must possess strong interpersonal skills and capable of relating to a variety of people and personalities
* Should enjoy working with the senior population
* Personal initiative and sound judgment are also required
* Must have word processing and clerical skills
Maplewood Senior Living conducts pre-employment screening including background check, drug screening and reference checks.

**Due to Department of Public Health requirements, all candidates will be required to show valid proof of full vaccination for COVID-19 (1****st** **vaccine, 2****nd** **vaccine, and booster) before commencing work, unless they receive an approved exemption from Maplewood. Those who do not obtain full vaccination and booster within that time frame, without an approved exemption, will be terminated.**
#### **Experience**
Preferred* Familiarity with telephone etiquette and Microsoft Suite programs.
#### **Education**
Preferred* High School or better

588f6259a0bca60c,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=588f6259a0bca60c","https://jobs.walgreens.com/en/job/-/-/1242/68819553120","Pharmacy Technician / Pharm Tech Apprenticeship","Walgreens","Staten Island, NY, US","parttime","2024-08-16","direct_data","hourly",17.0,20.0,"USD",False,"","","Retail","","","Our pharmacy technician positions have undergone an exciting transformation, moving from a transaction-based environment to a much more patient-centric one. As a Walgreens Pharmacy Technician or Pharmacy Technician Apprentice, you'll be front and center – interacting with our customers and developing strong patient relationships. Pharmacy is the core of our business, and our pharmacy technicians enjoy all the tools and support – including the latest technology – to grow their careers and reach their goals.

Walgreens is proud to invest & champion an “earn while you learn” Pharmacy Technician Training Program recognized by ASHP & Department of Labor. This apprenticeship program gives you an entry point to a career in health care by guiding you in taking steps towards becoming a Pharmacy Technician Certification Board (PTCB) Certified Pharmacy Technician and helping you maintain the high level of skill required in the pharmacy care industry. Arming you with a nationally recognized, portable credential that will help you advance your career.

Whether you are new to working in pharmacies or are an experienced Pharmacy Technician Apply Now! Walgreens will train you to use your skills and talents to serve and care for our patients and customers. The courses, learning activities, and resources provided to you in our pharmacy technician training program are designed to give you foundational and advanced knowledge, skills, and on-the-job experiences you need to prepare to become a certified pharmacy technician.

* In accordance with state and federal regulations, assists the pharmacist, under direct supervision, in the practice of pharmacy. Assists the pharmacist in the performance of other Pharmacy Department duties in accordance with Company policies and procedures.

* Responsible for using pharmacy systems to obtain patient and drug information and process prescriptions. If PTCB certified, assists with and coaches pharmacy technicians in the operation of pharmacy systems and cashiers in the operation of the pharmacy cash registers.
* Models and delivers a distinctive and delightful customer experience.

**Customer Experience*** Engages customers and patients by greeting them and offering assistance with products and services. Resolves customer issues and answers questions to ensure a positive customer experience.

* Models and shares customer service best practices with all team members to deliver a distinctive and delightful customer experience, including interpersonal habits (e.g., greeting, eye contact, courtesy, etc.) and Walgreens service traits (e.g., offering help proactively, identifying needs, servicing until satisfied, etc.).
* Develops strong relationships with most valuable customers.

**Operations*** Under the supervision by the pharmacist, assist in the practice of pharmacy, in accordance with state, federal, and company policy. Reviews and complies with the Walgreen Co. Pharmacy Code of Conduct.

* Performs duties as assigned by Pharmacy Manager, Staff Pharmacist and Store Manager including utilizing pharmacy systems to enter patient and drug information, ensuring information is entered correctly, filling prescriptions by retrieving, counting and pouring pharmaceutical drugs, verifying medicine is correct, and checking for possible interactions. Assists pharmacists in scheduling and maintaining work flow.
* Reports, immediately, prescription errors to pharmacist on duty and adheres to Company policies and procedures in relation to pharmacy errors and the Quality Improvement Program.
* Strictly adheres to the Walgreen Co. policy regarding Good Faith Dispensing during all applicable prescription dispensing activities.

* Responsible and accountable for registering all related sales on assigned cash register, collects and handles cash as required. Takes customer to OTC aisle when possible to assist in locating products.
* Handles telephone calls that do not require personal attention of the pharmacist, including those to physicians.

* Processes (corrects and resubmits) manual claims for third party program prescription services in a timely and efficient manner, and performs other clerical duties, as assigned by the Pharmacy Manager.

* Assists and supports Pharmacy Department on inventory management activities, such as, ordering, unpacking, checking and storing shipment of pharmaceuticals. Maintains knowledge of Company asset protection techniques, and files claims for warehouse overages (merchandise received, but not billed), shortages (merchandise billed, but not received), order errors or damaged goods involving Rx drugs.
* May assist pharmacist in administering clinical services including the collection and proper labeling of blood/urine samples from patients and other clinical services as required
column2: assists pharmacy staff in coordination of clinical services, Walgreens healthcare clinics and external providers.

column1: * Assists Pharmacy Manager and Staff Pharmacist in developing and maintaining good relationships with the local medical community, including physicians, nurses, and other health care providers, by medical provider detailing and outreach to health groups, retirement homes, nursing homes, and other forums for enhancing growth opportunities.
* Assists with exterior and interior maintenance by ensuring the Pharmacy Department is stocked with adequate supplies, clean, neat and orderly in condition and appearance.
* Complies with all company policies and procedures
column2: maintains respectful relationships with coworkers.

column1: * Completes special assignments and other tasks as assigned.

**Training & Personal Development*** Earns and maintains PTCB certification through the designated PTCB training program and/or state required certification/registration. Otherwise, earns PTCB certification as condition of promotion to senior technician.
* Attends training and completes PPLs requested by Manager and acquires continuing education credits. Maintains knowledge and skill in healthcare and pharmacy, including latest news and developments.

Through completion of the Walgreens pharmacy technician apprenticeship program, experience qualifies for eight (8) college credit hours as recognized by the American Council on Education (ACE). This course is recommended for 3 semester hours at the lower-division baccalaureate/associate degree category and 5 semester hours in the upper-division baccalaureate degree category for a total of 8 semester hours.
**Basic Qualifications**
* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English. (Except in Puerto Rico)
**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prefer six months of experience in a retail environment.
* Prefer to have prior work experience with Walgreens.
* Prefer good math skills so they can fill prescriptions accurately, including counting, measuring and weighing medications.
* Prefer good computer skills.
* Prefer the knowledge of store inventory control.
* Prefer PTCB certification.

**Customer Experience*** Engages customers and patients by greeting them and offering assistance with products and services. Resolves customer issues and answers questions to ensure a positive customer experience.

* Models and shares customer service best practices with all team members to deliver a distinctive and delightful customer experience, including interpersonal habits (e.g., greeting, eye contact, courtesy, etc.) and Walgreens service traits (e.g., offering help proactively, identifying needs, servicing until satisfied, etc.).
* Develops strong relationships with most valuable customers.

**Operations*** Under the supervision by the pharmacist, assist in the practice of pharmacy, in accordance with state, federal, and company policy. Reviews and complies with the Walgreen Co. Pharmacy Code of Conduct.

* Performs duties as assigned by Pharmacy Manager, Staff Pharmacist and Store Manager including utilizing pharmacy systems to enter patient and drug information, ensuring information is entered correctly, filling prescriptions by retrieving, counting and pouring pharmaceutical drugs, verifying medicine is correct, and checking for possible interactions. Assists pharmacists in scheduling and maintaining work flow.
* Reports, immediately, prescription errors to pharmacist on duty and adheres to Company policies and procedures in relation to pharmacy errors and the Quality Improvement Program.
* Strictly adheres to the Walgreen Co. policy regarding Good Faith Dispensing during all applicable prescription dispensing activities.

* Responsible and accountable for registering all related sales on assigned cash register, collects and handles cash as required. Takes customer to OTC aisle when possible to assist in locating products.
* Handles telephone calls that do not require personal attention of the pharmacist, including those to physicians.

* Processes (corrects and resubmits) manual claims for third party program prescription services in a timely and efficient manner, and performs other clerical duties, as assigned by the Pharmacy Manager.

* Assists and supports Pharmacy Department on inventory management activities, such as, ordering, unpacking, checking and storing shipment of pharmaceuticals. Maintains knowledge of Company asset protection techniques, and files claims for warehouse overages (merchandise received, but not billed), shortages (merchandise billed, but not received), order errors or damaged goods involving Rx drugs.
* May assist pharmacist in administering clinical services including the collection and proper labeling of blood/urine samples from patients and other clinical services as required
column2: assists pharmacy staff in coordination of clinical services, Walgreens healthcare clinics and external providers.

column1: * Assists Pharmacy Manager and Staff Pharmacist in developing and maintaining good relationships with the local medical community, including physicians, nurses, and other health care providers, by medical provider detailing and outreach to health groups, retirement homes, nursing homes, and other forums for enhancing growth opportunities.
* Assists with exterior and interior maintenance by ensuring the Pharmacy Department is stocked with adequate supplies, clean, neat and orderly in condition and appearance.
* Complies with all company policies and procedures
column2: maintains respectful relationships with coworkers.

column1: * Completes special assignments and other tasks as assigned.

**Training & Personal Development*** Earns and maintains PTCB or ExCPT certification through the designated PTCB training program and/or state required certification/registration. Otherwise, earns PTCB or ExCPT certification as condition of promotion to senior technician.
* Attends training and completes PPLs requested by Manager and acquires continuing education credits. Maintains knowledge and skill in healthcare and pharmacy, including latest news and developments.
**Basic Qualifications**
* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English. (Except in Puerto Rico)
* Requires willingness to work flexible schedule, including evening and weekend hours.
**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prefer six months of experience in a retail environment.
* Prefer to have prior work experience with Walgreens.
* Prefer good math skills so they can fill prescriptions accurately, including counting, measuring and weighing medications.
* Prefer good computer skills.
* Prefer the knowledge of store inventory control.
* Prefer PTCB or ExCPT certification.
